node.statement: (Field regularity under mu) The Phi^4_3 measure mu on T^3 is supported on the Holder-Besov space C^{-1/2-delta}(T^3) for every delta > 0. That is, for mu-a.e. field configuration phi, we have phi in C^{-1/2-delta}(T^3). This is established in Hairer (2014), Theorem 10.7 (regularity structures construction) and independently by Barashkov-Gubinelli (2020), Theorem 1.1 (variational construction). Both approaches construct mu as a limit of UV-regularized measures mu_eps and show the support property via Besov space embeddings and the Kolmogorov-type criterion: for phi_eps = rho_eps * phi, the moments E_mu[||phi_eps - phi_{eps'}||_{C^{-1/2-delta}}^p] are controlled uniformly, giving a.s. convergence in C^{-1/2-delta}(T^3).
